channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Contextual Emotion Recognition Using Transformer Based Models
item.description: In order to increase the precision of emotion identification in text, this research suggests a context-aware emotion recognition system employing transformer models, especially BERT.

item.title: Robust Distortion-free Watermarks for Language Models
item.description: We generate watermarked text by mapping a sequence of random numbers -- which we compute using a randomized watermark key -- to a sample from the language model.

item.title: Benchmarking Offline Reinforcement Learning on Real-Robot Hardware
item.description: To coordinate the efforts of the research community toward tackling this problem, we propose a benchmark including: i) a large collection of data for offline learning from a dexterous manipulation platform on two tasks, obtained with capable RL agents trained in simulation; ii) the option to execute learned policies on a real-world robotic system and a simulation for efficient debugging.

item.title: Shrink-Perturb Improves Architecture Mixing during Population Based Training for Neural Architecture Search
item.description: In this work, we show that simultaneously training and mixing neural networks is a promising way to conduct Neural Architecture Search (NAS).

item.title: TaskExpert: Dynamically Assembling Multi-Task Representations with Memorial Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: Furthermore, to establish long-range modeling of the task-specific representations from different layers of TaskExpert, we design a multi-task feature memory that updates at each layer and acts as an additional feature expert for dynamic task-specific feature decoding.

item.title: MLIC++: Linear Complexity Multi-Reference Entropy Modeling for Learned Image Compression
item.description: Recently, multi-reference entropy model has been proposed, which captures channel-wise, local spatial, and global spatial correlations.

item.title: Defocus Blur Synthesis and Deblurring via Interpolation and Extrapolation in Latent Space
item.description: We train autoencoders with implicit and explicit regularization techniques to enforce linearity relations among the representations of different blur levels in the latent space.

item.title: A Solution to Co-occurrence Bias: Attributes Disentanglement via Mutual Information Minimization for Pedestrian Attribute Recognition
item.description: Recent studies on pedestrian attribute recognition progress with either explicit or implicit modeling of the co-occurrence among attributes.

item.title: LUCID-GAN: Conditional Generative Models to Locate Unfairness
item.description: Most group fairness notions detect unethical biases by computing statistical parity metrics on a model's output.

item.title: Recovering high-quality FODs from a reduced number of diffusion-weighted images using a model-driven deep learning architecture
item.description: In this work, we propose a spherical deconvolution network, a model-driven deep learning FOD reconstruction architecture, that ensures intermediate and output FODs produced by the network are consistent with the input DWI signals.

item.title: ODTlearn: A Package for Learning Optimal Decision Trees for Prediction and Prescription
item.description: ODTLearn is an open-source Python package that provides methods for learning optimal decision trees for high-stakes predictive and prescriptive tasks based on the mixed-integer optimization (MIO) framework proposed in Aghaei et al. (2019) and several of its extensions.

item.title: Framework to Automatically Determine the Quality of Open Data Catalogs
item.description: Data catalogs play a crucial role in modern data-driven organizations by facilitating the discovery, understanding, and utilization of diverse data assets.

item.title: Multiple Instance Learning Framework with Masked Hard Instance Mining for Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: The whole slide image (WSI) classification is often formulated as a multiple instance learning (MIL) problem.

item.title: Multilingual Lexical Simplification via Paraphrase Generation
item.description: After feeding the input sentence into the encoder of paraphrase modeling, we generate the substitutes based on a novel decoding strategy that concentrates solely on the lexical variations of the complex word.

item.title: Is this model reliable for everyone? Testing for strong calibration
item.description: In a well-calibrated risk prediction model, the average predicted probability is close to the true event rate for any given subgroup.

item.title: 'What are you referring to?' Evaluating the Ability of Multi-Modal Dialogue Models to Process Clarificational Exchanges
item.description: Referential ambiguities arise in dialogue when a referring expression does not uniquely identify the intended referent for the addressee.

item.title: A Practical Recipe for Federated Learning Under Statistical Heterogeneity Experimental Design
item.description: Many of the works use inconsistent experimental settings and there are no comprehensive studies on the effect of FL-specific experimental variables on the results and practical insights for a more comparable and consistent FL experimental setup.

item.title: Improvable Gap Balancing for Multi-Task Learning
item.description: In this paper, following the loss balancing framework, we propose two novel improvable gap balancing (IGB) algorithms for MTL: one takes a simple heuristic, and the other (for the first time) deploys deep reinforcement learning for MTL.

item.title: Learning Nonlinear Projections for Reduced-Order Modeling of Dynamical Systems using Constrained Autoencoders
item.description: To begin to address these issues, we introduce a parametric class of nonlinear projections described by constrained autoencoder neural networks in which both the manifold and the projection fibers are learned from data.

item.title: Differential Evolution Algorithm based Hyper-Parameters Selection of Transformer Neural Network Model for Load Forecasting
item.description: We apply several metaheuristics namely Differential Evolution to find the optimal hyperparameters of the Transformer-based Neural Network to produce accurate forecasts.

item.title: Investigating the Learning Behaviour of In-context Learning: A Comparison with Supervised Learning
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have shown remarkable capacity for in-context learning (ICL), where learning a new task from just a few training examples is done without being explicitly pre-trained.

item.title: The Road to Quality is Paved with Good Revisions: A Detailed Evaluation Methodology for Revision Policies in Incremental Sequence Labelling
item.description: Incremental dialogue model components produce a sequence of output prefixes based on incoming input.

item.title: When to generate hedges in peer-tutoring interactions
item.description: This paper explores the application of machine learning techniques to predict where hedging occurs in peer-tutoring interactions.

item.title: Is One Epoch All You Need For Multi-Fidelity Hyperparameter Optimization?
item.description: Hyperparameter optimization (HPO) is crucial for fine-tuning machine learning models but can be computationally expensive.

item.title: Co-attention Graph Pooling for Efficient Pairwise Graph Interaction Learning
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have proven to be effective in processing and learning from graph-structured data.

item.title: From continuous-time formulations to discretization schemes: tensor trains and robust regression for BSDEs and parabolic PDEs
item.description: The numerical approximation of partial differential equations (PDEs) poses formidable challenges in high dimensions since classical grid-based methods suffer from the so-called curse of dimensionality.

item.title: Scaling Data Generation in Vision-and-Language Navigation
item.description: Recent research in language-guided visual navigation has demonstrated a significant demand for the diversity of traversable environments and the quantity of supervision for training generalizable agents.

item.title: OAFuser: Towards Omni-Aperture Fusion for Light Field Semantic Segmentation of Road Scenes
item.description: To avoid feature loss during network propagation and simultaneously streamline the redundant information from the light field camera, we present a simple yet very effective Sub-Aperture Fusion Module (SAFM) to embed sub-aperture images into angular features without any additional memory cost.

item.title: Quantum-noise-limited optical neural networks operating at a few quanta per activation
item.description: We experimentally demonstrated MNIST classification with a test accuracy of 98% using an optical neural network with a hidden layer operating in the single-photon regime; the optical energy used to perform the classification corresponds to 0. 008 photons per multiply-accumulate (MAC) operation, which is equivalent to 0. 003 attojoules of optical energy per MAC.

item.title: Backdoor Defense with Non-Adversarial Backdoor
item.description: Deep neural networks (DNNs) are vulnerable to backdoor attack, which does not affect the network's performance on clean data but would manipulate the network behavior once a trigger pattern is added.

item.title: Scale-aware Test-time Click Adaptation for Pulmonary Nodule and Mass Segmentation
item.description: Extensive experiments on both open-source and in-house datasets consistently demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method over some CNN and Transformer-based segmentation methods.

item.title: Attentive Multimodal Fusion for Optical and Scene Flow
item.description: This paper presents an investigation into the estimation of optical and scene flow using RGBD information in scenarios where the RGB modality is affected by noise or captured in dark environments.

item.title: Generative AI for Medical Imaging: extending the MONAI Framework
item.description: We have implemented these models in a generalisable fashion, illustrating that their results can be extended to 2D or 3D scenarios, including medical images with different modalities (like CT, MRI, and X-Ray data) and from different anatomical areas.

item.title: Weakly Supervised AI for Efficient Analysis of 3D Pathology Samples
item.description: Human tissue and its constituent cells form a microenvironment that is fundamentally three-dimensional (3D).

item.title: Take-A-Photo: 3D-to-2D Generative Pre-training of Point Cloud Models
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel 3D-to-2D generative pre-training method that is adaptable to any point cloud model.

item.title: Machine Learning-powered Pricing of the Multidimensional Passport Option
item.description: These approaches prove to be successful for pricing the passport option in one-dimensional and multi-dimensional uncorrelated BS markets.

item.title: Mixture of Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: Therefore, we propose the Gated Self-Supervised Learning method to improve image classification which use more than one transformation as pretext task and uses the Mixture of Expert architecture as a gating network in combining each pretext task so that the model automatically can study and focus more on the most useful augmentations for classification.

item.title: Counterfactual Explanations for Graph Classification Through the Lenses of Density
item.description: Counterfactual examples have emerged as an effective approach to produce simple and understandable post-hoc explanations.

item.title: High Dynamic Range Imaging via Visual Attention Modules
item.description: Thanks to High Dynamic Range (HDR) imaging methods, the scope of photography has seen profound changes recently.

item.title: Pre-training Vision Transformers with Very Limited Synthesized Images
item.description: Prior work on FDSL has shown that pre-training vision transformers on such synthetic datasets can yield competitive accuracy on a wide range of downstream tasks.

item.title: Improving Natural Language Inference in Arabic using Transformer Models and Linguistically Informed Pre-Training
item.description: This paper addresses the classification of Arabic text data in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), with a particular focus on Natural Language Inference (NLI) and Contradiction Detection (CD).

item.title: Taxonomy Adaptive Cross-Domain Adaptation in Medical Imaging via Optimization Trajectory Distillation
item.description: The success of automated medical image analysis depends on large-scale and expert-annotated training sets.

item.title: P2C: Self-Supervised Point Cloud Completion from Single Partial Clouds
item.description: Point cloud completion aims to recover the complete shape based on a partial observation.

item.title: Test Time Adaptation for Blind Image Quality Assessment
item.description: In this work, we introduce two novel quality-relevant auxiliary tasks at the batch and sample levels to enable TTA for blind IQA.

item.title: Brain Age Estimation Using Structural MRI: A Clustered Federated Learning Approach
item.description: Estimating brain age based on structural Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) is one of the most challenging and prominent areas of research in recent medical imaging and neuroscience studies.

item.title: To Adapt or Not to Adapt? Real-Time Adaptation for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: The goal of Online Domain Adaptation for semantic segmentation is to handle unforeseeable domain changes that occur during deployment, like sudden weather events.

item.title: New Interaction Paradigm for Complex EDA Software Leveraging GPT
item.description: In the rapidly growing field of electronic design automation (EDA), professional software such as KiCad, Cadence , and Altium Designer provide increasingly extensive design functionalities.

item.title: HTNet for micro-expression recognition
item.description: The transformer layer is used to focus on representing local minor muscle movement with local self-attention in each area.

item.title: LLDiffusion: Learning Degradation Representations in Diffusion Models for Low-Light Image Enhancement
item.description: In this paper, we address this limitation by proposing a degradation-aware learning scheme for LLIE using diffusion models, which effectively integrates degradation and image priors into the diffusion process, resulting in improved image enhancement.

item.title: IML-ViT: Image Manipulation Localization by Vision Transformer
item.description: Besides, artifacts are sensitive to image resolution, amplified under multi-scale features, and massive at the manipulation border.
